item.title: Jenava add a quote by Barbara Bush
Jenava add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Pearl Buck
item.description: "A good marriage is one which allows for change and growth in the individuals and in the way they express their love. " -- Pearl Buck

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Jenava add a quote by René Descartes
item.description: "If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things." -- René Descartes

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Euripides
item.description: "The wisest men follow their own direction." -- Euripides

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Anatole Broyard
item.description: "There was a time when we expected nothing of our children but obedience, as opposed to the present, when we expect everything of them but obedience. " -- Anatole Broyard

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jenava add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "It is a fine thing to establish one's own religion in one's heart, not to be dependent on tradition and second-hand ideals. Life will seem to you, later, not a lesser, but a greater thing." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Dan Rather
item.description: "Americans will put up with anything provided it doesn't block traffic." -- Dan Rather

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Plato
item.description: "If women are expected to do the same work as men, we must teach them the same things." -- Plato

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Edmond De Goncourt
item.description: "A painting in a museum hears more ridiculous opinions than anything else in the world." -- Edmond De Goncourt

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is to not stop questioning." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Force is all conquering, but it's victories are short lived." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jenava add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off." -- Gloria Steinem

item.title: Jenava add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne
